Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Luke H
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. It's not the Ritz, but it's clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. It's in a convenient location within a few minutes' walk of Little Italy, and about half an hour's walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. It's also very close to the airport. The staff are super-helpful. Breakfast is included: it's OK but not amazing. There's a trolley line close by which creates a bit of noise, but it wasn't noisy enough to disturb my sleep. Overall I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hllindsay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, (before and after our cruise). We could not have been happier. The rooms were great, clean, and a decent size. The staff was wonderful, even accomodating us for an early check in when we got off the ship. Being one of the few hotels in San Diego where you can get a smoking room, it was a fantastic choice. If we ever go back to San Diego we will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Our rugby team enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry F
Reviews.Content: Our college rugby team recently booked 8 rooms for two nights at the Marina Inn & Suites in San Diego for a tournament. The hotel staff at the front desk were really great to work with and accomodated our late arrival and early departure each morning by setting up the breakfast early for us. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the price was reasonable. It is only a two block walk to Little Italy and lots of great restaurants and a $7 cab ride to the Gas Lamp Dist. A great place to stay for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, nice rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: moshank
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very neat and clean. The bathrooms could have been a bit bigger. The service was excellent. The people at the front desk were very friendly and extremely helpful. Well definitely stay there again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Utahwoman52
Reviews.Content: The Marina Inn and Suites in San Diego- We recently stayed there for a 2 night visit to San Diego; as we were on a budget, this hotel/motel was inexpensive, very, very clean and super convenient to everything. Even though it is on a busy corner, it was very quiet in the rooms. The staff was fantastic and went out of their way at every opportunity to help out with anything from printing out directions, to making sure you had everything you needed. It is a one block walk to the harbour, 2 block walk to Little Italy, just down from the freeway entrances, and close to downtown. The room itself is very, very basic (bring your own hairdryer!) no microwave or fridge, but very clean. There are only about 15 rooms so there are no big crowds. No pool or jacuzzi. If you are looking for a place to sleep that is convenient and easy to get to, this is a great place. Another nice thing is that the car rental places are just up the street, so it was easy to return our car as well-no driving around lost or with maps!

Reviews.Title: “They bend over backwards to assist you!”
Reviews.Author: TeQuieroPV
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Sunday Feb.19, 2012 for a job interview in the area. The hotel is about 1 mile from the San Diego airport. I took a city bus from the airport to get there, which stops about 1/2 block away (fare $2.25). I had a king bed with a microwave, fridge, coffeepot and hairdryer in the room. The color TV had a special "flat" remote control that was easy for the staff to disinfect. This suite also had a separate little room with a twin bed off the main room. I could not hear anything from the rooms next to me. The heater worked well, as it was a bit chilly in the early morning. It was impecably clean and well stocked with towels. The free breakfast was more than expected, consisting of oj, coffee/tea/cocoa, a selection of muffins, HB eggs, oatmeal/cold cereal and fruit. There is a bit of traffic noise along with the airplane and train sounds but that didn't affect my sleep or daytime reading. The most important thing I can mention about this hotel is the amazing staff, Arti and Chirag. They always had a smile and offered their assistance. I didn't have a cell phone and they let me use the hotel phone free for all the cab calls and airline reservations I had to make. They would look up the numbers for me and were always available and offered helpful information with directions. My husband was calling from Mexico and he said they were very polite and friendly in connecting him to my room. I would definitely stay there again. I couldn't have had a better experience. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Quick W/E trip”
Reviews.Author: frankspurs
Reviews.Content: Conviently located between the airport and downtown, I was able to get everywhere by public transport. It is located just down the hill from Little Italy which is full of good bars and restaurants. The room was very clean, plenty of towels, TV had lots of premium channels, the only drawback was a lack of fridge. I would definatley stay here again and have no problems recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Gregor L
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the marina inn for a week. the employed were very friendly and helpful. the rooms were clean. we would go in this hotel agen, if we come back to san diego.

Reviews.Title: “More good than bad”
Reviews.Author: Marcus4
Reviews.Content: This was a nice motel. We wanted a place near the Cruise ship terminal and the airport and the Marina Inn was between those two points. Unfortunately the combination of the Pacific Highway (a main thoroufare) and active railroad tracks less than a block from the back of the hotel made for a noisy night. The room was spacious and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast was available at the front desk, (coffee, juice danish and hard boiled eggs), but you had to take them back to the room. The people behind the desk were very helpful and knowledgable and the marina inn offered a very reasonable rate to "park and sail."

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: rachel w
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like you really can't get away from the noise of the traffic and train if you want to stay in downtown San Diego. Not the hotel's fault, but just something to keep in mind when deciding where to stay. I'm not sure if it was just our room, but the water heater was excessively loud when the shower was on an the wireless internet was very slow, and sometimes didn't even work at all. But you can't beat the price for a clean, comfortable place to sleep and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: R0thFamily
Reviews.Content: Excellent location next to airport, SeaWorld, highway. We got a queen room with two queen beds. Staff is good and fast check in was done late at night, any problem was answered fast or fixed immediately. Room was spacious and clean. The neighborhood is safe. Parking is limited, but no problem to find a space to park. The breakfast is a little limited but ok for the price. We recommends this to our friends, and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and cheap but way too noisy”
Reviews.Author: deadseashoals
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay and the price and location were great, but there was an incredible amount of noise coming from the street and the airport, and the design of the hotel really exacerbates this issue. I really can't recommend staying here unless you're a very sound sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: captainoneliner
Reviews.Content: I've seen the reviews of this place as a mixed bag, but overall I thought it was a great deal and a solid experience. Staff is helpful and friendly, room was nice and clean, location is great. There are all sorts of great restaurants, drinking establishments, things to do within a short walk or ride. I felt the neighborhood was safe, I had no issues walking around at night. The parking is limited, but I had no trouble keeping a space as I was on foot in the evenings. The hotel is indeed located near rail service and the airport, so it has noise from that.. but the other hotels in the area are also near it.. and some are very pricey. I honestly don't feel my sleep quality was affected.

Reviews.Title: “In the end a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Opray26
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given room 208 which was in the far corner, we put our bags in the room after a long drive and decided to head into San Diego for something to eat. Returning later I decided to close the curtains ready for bed but noticed the window had no lock and the outside panel had been tampered with, my immediate thought was somebody had been in but luckily that was not the case. I demanded a room change as we did not feel secure and to the hotels credit they eventually upgraded us to a better family size room with no extra cost and we went on to enjoy our stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “look at the bright side”
Reviews.Author: betty g
Reviews.Content: wonderful location next to airport, trolly, downtown, nightlife, etc. employees were helpful but the night auditor jr was the most help with our stay. upon checking our group in jr helped with the reservation of a wonderful restaurant (godfathers) which was the best restaurant italian wise, comparable to italy's food itself. beaches were great and the stay couldnt be anybetter. besides getting woken up by the nearby train, but its not the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “lost of words”
Reviews.Author: nathan c
Reviews.Content: front desk staff was the best part of the hotel itself. Jr the front desk agent at night was very helpful in helping us find places to eat. since my wife is pregnant their is only certain things that she can eat and jr helped us find such restaurant. the hotel is ok just your standard eat and sleep but the location is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed this place very well”
Reviews.Author: tim c
Reviews.Content: upon my arrival i was very pleased with the location it is right next to the harbor, and downtown as well as local traveler attractions and freeway entrances and exits. and it helps that it is 5 minutes away from the airport. my daughter got sick and the night auditor helped us out with a near by location were we can get some medicine. Jr was very helpful in giving us step by step directions since we are not from san diego it helped us out alot. i was very pleased how our trip turned out and will return again since that particular employee helped us in such a crucial time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews on this place, it is only OK”
Reviews.Author: Midnitesun3
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff's hospitality was the best part of the hotel - but you get what you pay for for the most part, a shower, a sink, beds, TV, microwave, fridge, wifi, and enough food to tide you over to lunch. Stayed in the kid's suite (room 109) so each person could have their own bed. The soda/vending/ice machines were right next door so each time someone went in to get an item, they slammed the heavy iron metal door which scared everyone in the room. I could not figure out which was louder: the planes landing, the trains blowing their whistles, the gridlock (car horns) from the busy intersection right out front, or the metal door being slammed every so often. We asked housekeeping to not clean our rooms and even put up the do not disturb sign. Lo and behold when we came back later that day, they not only did clean our room, but they took a personal item of mine and also replaced the towels that we had on the racks with new ones (the sign says they would only replace them if they were thrown on the floor), I at least got a sorry but that was it. They replaced the towels that were on the rack, but did not leave enough towels for everyone in the room and no washcloths were replaced. NOT happy about that at all. As others state the breakfast room is the front desk area so no more than 3 people could be in there at the same time and there is no place to sit down and eat. They had cereal, muffins and eggs. We tried the eggs the first day but they smelled and tasted sour so we spit them out and had muffins the rest of the stay. Other posts about parking are correct, we stayed Mon and checked out Thurs, Mon and Tues nights were fine but by Wed night the parking lot was full so we snuck in next door at another inn. It wasn't a horrible experience but I don't think I will be returning to this hotel, would rather try others out in the same price range to see if I can find better sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great”
Reviews.Author: henry d
Reviews.Content: Front desk guy (John) was quite helpful with any concerns. Questions were answered fast and professional. He made the couple of days worth coming back for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good position”
Reviews.Author: SalazarCityRiptide
Reviews.Content: Very nice, good position, the room is clan, the brunch is not bad and John, the guy at the reception is very kind and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel with a great staff. Thank You, Desk Clerk JOHN!”
Reviews.Author: Sune T
Reviews.Content: We found the Marina Inn and Suites to be a delightful place to stay in San Diego. The location was convenient to the waterfront, Balboa Park, the San Diego Zoo, and the entrance to Interstate 5 so that you could easily navigate through the San Diego maze. We were especially pleased with the staff, who were quite helpful and courteous. Desk clerk John was especially helpful. He suggested some excellent restaurants. We liked "The Fish Market". That was a REMARKABLE choice of his. He was quite helpful at marking maps so that we could easily find our way around. John also recommended a beach at La Jolla that was one of the best I've ever been. Our mini vacation was memorable. Great Inn!

Reviews.Title: “noisy, noisy and noisy. worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: tautau293984
Reviews.Content: we weren't able to sleep at all! The noise came from three different places: 1. the highway which is located in the front of the so cold 'hotel'. 2. the airport you could hear airplanes flying. 3. the neighbors. the acoustic of the room was terrible, you could hear people walking and showering on the above floor.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfectly situated for getting around San Diego wthout having to drive your car”
Reviews.Author: gjfoss
Reviews.Content: John at the front desk was always very helpful & gave us the great suggestion of taking the Hop-on-off bus from Little Italy & that was a great tip. We had a fantastic time & saw what we wanted to see. He had lots of great advice & that was helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tamale0110
Reviews.Content: We rented the Kid's Suite for our annual 'Gal Pal' get together and it worked out perfectly. The rooms had plenty of beds, a large refrigerator, a microwave and an ocean view. The location was wonderful...we didn't have to move our cars the whole weekend. John at the front desk was especially helpful and friendly and really contributed to our fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good locatoin”
Reviews.Author: mpsflu
Reviews.Content: excelent locaton, good price, good rooms. The room does not have a refrigerator and it is important.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ikkuh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in June 2011. As the other reviewers noticed, it's a rather noisy area to stay (planes, traffic, and especially the Amtrak passing by every 10 minutes or so). I have to say it didn't bother me that much though, and I slept fairly well. My room was spacious, the bed was huge for a single person, and the airco did what it was supposed to do. All in all a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, budget friendly.”
Reviews.Author: tl4tl
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on TA we decided to stay at this hotel. It is on a busy intersection but you can't beat the price. The hotel is dated, but the rooms are clean, and it has a decent little breakfast. We had some noise issues on Friday night but it wasn't out of control. If your on a budget then I would recommend this hotel. Keep in mind the train runs behind this hotel but it will also run right behind the other hotels on this PC. Little Italy is literally a block walk and is full of great food and restaurants. John was very sweet at the front desk and gave us a free appetizer coupon to use in Old Town which was yummy.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars ??? someone should remove 2 of those !!!”
Reviews.Author: ziad1967
Reviews.Content: well, first the rooms are so small, the "kids suite" was a 7X11 foot (closet), with bunk bed. the bathroom is so extra small too. the microwave is good, also is the refrigerator(this one is a good size)better than other hotels, the reception/breakfast area is also Extra ultra small, only 3 guests can fit in there, we stayed for 4 days, 3nights, you should go to the reception room to get your breakfast into your room, since there is no place to sit(nor stand up) the onlyfin food we got there was acid tasting boiled eggs, mini cereal boxes, and packaged muffins. coffe, tea, milk, and orange juice were available.but it was impossible to not spill all of the drinks on your way out, while you push the not automatic door of the breakfast /reception room. the receptionist didnt even bother to help, was too busy chatting with a colleague.and although we put the "DO NOT disturb" sign, on our way out of the room, we found that our room was cleaned anyway. overall, to be honest, the hotel location, is great, but, so is a dozen of similar hotels on the same side of the street. although the noise was intense (S.D airport, and trains passing every few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Rock and Roll Marathon weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JulieAPH
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy check-in. Within walking distance of restaurants, public transportation, farmers' market, ocean, marathon route. Very helpful front desk staff. I read several reviews of the Marina Inn at TripAdvisor that mentioned airport, train, and trolley noise. For me, that noise was noticeable but no big deal. It didn't go on all night and didn't interfere with sleep or overall enjoyment of my stay in San Diego. Room had an ocean view and was very clean. Maid service was prompt and efficient. But for a Midwesterner, the smell of the ocean was reason enough to enjoy staying at the Marina Inn and return again. It is certainly not a luxury property but was perfect for a long, busy weekend in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sandfamily29
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and smelled great. We even got to check in early! the appliances in the room were all updated and nice. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for cruise passengers”
Reviews.Author: sewa123
Reviews.Content: John and Jayson working at the reception desk were outstanding - gave us great info on what to do in San Diego. Outstanding service!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall; poor sleep quality due to outside noise.”
Reviews.Author: katelin_87
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a good motel. The staff were friendly upon check-in and the rooms were decent. On our first night, however, we noticed blood stains on the sheets of one beds, and strange black stains covering one of the pillows. We reported this to front desk who apologised and immediately brought us new sheets and pillows (although we thought that housekeeping should not have missed this in the first place). Location-wise, it is in a good spot. Only a street or two away from Little Italy, where there are a lot of great restaurants (and an awesome Farmers' Market on Saturday). About a 20 minute walk to the city centre, and right across the road from the Marina. A really nice area. We did experience an issue with noise, as we were woken every morning by planes landing and trains going past (the motel is right next to train tracks and a couple of kms from the airport). We were on the ground floor, so adding to this was the noise of other guests walking past and housekeeping trolleys. I would recommend requesting a room on the top floor as this may help with some of the noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not Expensive and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yaro2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marina Inn and Suites for 3 nights for business. Rooms were accomodating and staff was very friendly and helpful. You can't beat the price considering we had other colleagues paying $235.00 a night and $34.00 a day for parking. We had a nice continental breakfast to where they did not. The only bad thing I have to say about the Hotel is it is very loud and noisy. You are near the airport and can hear all the planes land and taking off (very busy airport), also, I stayed on the first floor and you could hear people walking upstairs and closing car doors in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “nice with family”
Reviews.Author: kjsukow
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night the location is good. Nice that the hotel has room's for a family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “best service ever”
Reviews.Author: lemusmaria
Reviews.Content: I took my family out to san diego for a little get away while dad was out of town.. we stayed at the marina inn which was nice, no teenagers around making loud noise just like jayson the front desk man said..he also guided us around the bay area to ocean beach,downtown,great resturants. your lucky to have such a great man working at your two finest hotels.. ( pacific inn) we aslo stayed there before one night the marina inn had full rooms around feb. great service knows how to talk to people and with eye contact, thats why we come back. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Bextraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just once night and wished we were staying longer! John on reception was extremely helpful. We arrived early and were allowed to leave our car in the car park. We met a local just after arriving who told us to head to the farmers market (we were there on a Saturday) and it was amazing. We were able to walk to most places and had a lovely full day. John advised us on catching the tram to the Old town too. Our only gripe is that we didnt plan to stay longer!! Location of motel is great, room clean (no fridge though, which would have been nice). No problems sleeping. Close to Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: bonbon002
Reviews.Content: this was the second time I stayed,since I had to take bus and train I arrived very early for check in and John was real helpful in holding my luggage while I go to lunch until my room was finished being cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice rooms, ideal for us.”
Reviews.Author: Cherrykim
Reviews.Content: The hotel had free parking and we didn't have a problem getting a space here, but I can imagine in busier seasons, it could be difficult. The service wasn't that great to be honest, my biggest gripe is when I don't get a smile, we didn't. We were jut briefly informed of where our room was and when breakfast would be served. The room was great, clean, spacious etc. Very happy with it. We were close enough to plenty of things. The continental breakfast was a joke. A few boxes of serial, cold boiled eggs, and there was never any bread etc left. (we weren't late going down) Served in the reception area which is really small and cramped. Not worth it to be honest. Other than that, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “costumer service made staying at this hotel twice as good. Job well done Emily!”
Reviews.Author: j0rdand
Reviews.Content: While i was staying at this hotel, i wanted to get out and see San Diego (i am new to this state) and costumer service at the front desk was so helpful and kind with giving me the necessary information i needed. I have a specific person i would like to give recognition to and that is Emily. She did such a splendid job at keeping me comfortable and answering all of my questions and concerns and also suggested advice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel that's fully worth the money and costumer service that makes u feel at home!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: David777771
Reviews.Content: Good room but no hair dryer. Great value for the location. No airport shuttle. the taxi from the hotel to the airport in San Diego was $7.50 for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, basic. Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: AvivTuttnauer
Reviews.Content: This modest inn, located just between the airport and downtown San Diego, is basic. You've got a room. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice. Note that the hotel is very close to an airport, a main road, and a busy railroad. I needed a place to rest my head between 11pm-6am, and was very pleased. I am not a light sleeper, though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: ZPiratesB
Reviews.Content: We drove to San Diego for an annual gathering and needed a place to stay during our busy weekend. We booked ahead and got a great rate through John at the front desk, who was a pleasure to deal with, as was the woman who checked us in. The rooms are clean, comfortable and basic. My room had cable tv, a small fridge, microwave, a safety deposit box, and a clear view of the marina. The continental breakfast was individually boxed cereal and muffins, hard boiled eggs, coffee, tea, juice, and milk. Here are my pros and cons: PROS -great location (easy access to major highways and a short walk to the marina, cruiseport, and the fabulous restaurants of Little Italy, including a late night hand-tossed pizzeria!) -free WIFI (it was slow at times but sufficient for a quick check of email or googling for directions) CONS -parking (parking is free but limited. There seem to be just enough spaces for one car per room and we didn't have any problems during our stay but I could see parking being an issue for someone else) -noise (the inn is on a busy intersection, near train tracks and also near the flight path of the San Diego airport. You will hear passing cars most of the time, an occasional train and a plane or two fly over. It's not so bad...more like background noise. If you are sensitive to noise, bring earplugs for when you sleep. We grew up in the city so we are used to background noise and we slept like babies...without earplugs!) Bottom line...There is no swimming pool, no spa, nothing fancy. If you want the Ritz, stay elsewhere. If you are going to be out and about and need a clean, comfortable place to stay on a budget, then this it it! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mmille27
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were warmly greeted by John at the reception desk. He was very helpful and put us into the 'honeymoon' suite which was very kind of him. Throughout our stay he was very helpful, he told us of places of interest and printed directions for us. We have had a great time in San Diego and have seen things we may have missed had it not been for his fantastic local knowledge. Thanks John!

Reviews.Title: “Two very satisfied customers!”
Reviews.Author: Daisy186342
Reviews.Content: Room clean and very well furnished.Big bed very comfortable! Staff could not be more friendly and obligeing. Very convenient location within easy walking distance of a number of attractions,especially restaurants and the sea-front. Trolley tour of the city and visit to USS "Midway" are well worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location @ a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Zonie1980
Reviews.Content: I spent about a week reviewing and pricing hotels. Marina Inn & Suites seemed too good to be true. The location is footsteps away from the Bay and Downtown SD. It's an easy location to find and get to. The rooms were clean and the staff made exceptional accomodations. I arrived 2 hours early and I was able to check in without any additional fees. The rooms are very clean! There are a few slight things that one should be aware of. This hotel is on a busy street, next to the light rail and is very close to the airport. The parking lot is somewhat small and was a little challenging to park my Tahoe at times. I feel these small factors are beyond anyone's control considering the prime location of this hotel. However, I would absolutely recommend anyone to stay here and I have made this hotel my 2nd home while in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Thank's for a great week!”
Reviews.Author: belladog31
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for a wonderful week in San Diego at the Pacific Highway Marina Inn. The hotel itself was quite fine and clean. As a very senior traveler with some mobility issues, I really appreciated the care and attention they paid to my needs. As I was on my own it was even more wonderful to experience the care and help of the desk staff, especially John. He helped me to plan my touring day, tutored me on the tranportation system and looked after me like a caring son. I was able to go out every day and see a lot of San Diego because of his care and attention. Thank you so much, and my children thank you too!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable option, good location, but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: gtdlx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while in San Diego. The inn is very well located, close to transit, the harbour and Little Italy. The room was mostly okay, but the bathroom wasn't the cleanest - huge rust spot on one corner of the tub, and some kind of black staining on the bottom. I didn't really like showering in it. The lower grade for sleep quality comes from being close to the Amtrak train rails and trolley - not the inn's fault, but it was difficult to get to sleep with whistles going off regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RavenBloodRaven
Reviews.Content: This motel is THE perfect place to stay! John, the front desk clerk, was very friendly, helpful, and goes the extra mile for guests!! It has a nice view, comfortable, plenty of things to do. I highly recommend it to anyone needing a home away from home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value motel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Andywilson460
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean, good TV channels, and John the manager was really excellent. Lots of good recommendations and includes a breakfast! Great for those with a hire car and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with nicely renovated rooms and super San Diego Bay view.”
Reviews.Author: David5046
Reviews.Content: Exterior of hotel is very dated; however, rooms have been nicely updated (new carpet, new furniture with granite countertops, and well appointed.) My room had a small refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. The bathroom was updated with a granite countertop, new fixtures, and new tile floor. The included continental breakfast is acceptable...but not much variety--cereal, oatmeal, boiled eggs, baked goods, orange juice, coffee, and fruit (apples and oranges.) The hotel location is great. Most rooms have views of the San Diego bay and a trolley station is one block away.

Reviews.Title: “A very reasonably-priced hotel right next to the San Diego airport.”
Reviews.Author: Marc_In_Oakland
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my family stayed near the San Diego Airport, and we chose the Marina Inn after review the review in the AAA book. We were very happy with the location, and the many restaurants within walking distance (a Denny's one block north, a really good mexican restaurant two blocks south, and all of Little Italy two blocks east). We had wanted a family suite with a king bed, but the first night we stayed, all that was available was two queens with a bunk bed for our son. After that night, we were able to switch to a room with the beds that we preferred, and all was good. When we requested additional furnishings (an extra chair and towel), they were very quickly provided. Absolutely no complaints about the service. The only thing that was less than ideal was the sound of the airplanes landing (every few minutes). Because the airport is so close by, though, there's really nothing they could do about that.

Reviews.Title: “Planes, Trains and Automobiles!”
Reviews.Author: Manx_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We looked at the hotel as a cheap option near to the downtown and harbour areas. In that respect it is great. We were able to park the car up and leave it for free in the hotel car park until we left three days later. The rooms are fairly standard motel style and had the basics you would expect – TV, coffee maker, safe, drawer space, etc. There was only a shower and whilst it was good to see an abundance of quality toiletries, it does need to be said that the towels were dire! Breakfast is collected each morning from the small reception area and taken back to your room. This includes orange juice, hot drinks, cereals, fruits, eggs and muffins. Nothing fantastic but included in your room tariff and enough to put you on until lunchtime. Reception staff were friendly and helpful (especially John) providing advice and maps of the area and answering questions as we needed. For some the noise may be an issue. Probably to be avoided if you are a light sleeper. There is an intersection right outside the hotel, planes fly virtually overhead on their approach to the airport (although those taking off are perhaps more noisy) and a train line runs close to the back of the hotel – listen out for the train’s horn around 07.00! In a way this is the price to be paid for the location – there are couple of other motels close by and they would have the same issues. The good points on the location is that downtown is a 15 minute walk, Little Italy just round the corner, 5-10 minutes walk to the harbourside, Maritime Museum and Cruise Terminal and the nearest trolley stop is just a couple of blocks away. We felt safe walking at night although there were one or two panhandlers in the area. All in all, it fulfilled our requirements. Would we stay here again? Well we would definitely visit San Diego which is a delightful city. The Marina Inn and Suites would be a good option if you keep your expectations fairly low, want to be close to Downtown and/or the harbour and don’t mind the ongoing noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great service.,.,”
Reviews.Author: gregory_723
Reviews.Content: I have vacationed here over the last two years and i have stay here and i dont have any complaints really and all the employees are really helpfull and have never been rude to me like at some other places. The location is good and the airport is across the street so some people dont like the noise but its not too bad the times ive stayed there. Overall i really enjoyed my stay and the rooms are always clean and neat and not dirty at all which is very important to me. I became friends with John who tends to be there on the weekends when i would stay there and he was a really good worker and helped us even when he didnt have to and even gave me some tickets for a comedy show which was great. Appreciated the help from him and all the staff. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, clean and comfortable rooms all for a great value”
Reviews.Author: hausp
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value which is what drew us to it in the first place. But after staying there for four nights, we would return because of the accommodating staff and clean and comfortable rooms. Plus it is within walking distance of so many downtown San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Elan_KL
Reviews.Content: I arrived in SAN Diego on the 16th Nov nite, and experience a very bad service and poor room quality in a nearby hotel. Immediately on the morning I walk down and found Marina Inn - where I felt the warmth of Asian Hospitality with the provision of Info requested. The room was a great and service at reception with providing neccessary infomation to 1st time traveller to San Diego was good. Location to restaurants and downtown, and local rail/trolley was very convenient. The staff I would like to thank are Nisha and Emily. Elangovan

Reviews.Title: “A cheap, decent hotel very close to airport/port/downtown”
Reviews.Author: arenteh
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel (more like a motel?..) before going on a cruise, and I could not wish for a more appropriate place: there was nothing fancy about it, it was cheap, clean, surprisingly spacious, and very close to the airport (not even 5min in a taxi, for like $10), port (5min walk to get to the ship, no need to take a taxi), and downtown (10-15min walk to the very core of downtown). We were three adults and a small child, so I booked a room with two queen beds, and it worked very well. Yes, it was on the first floor, so you can hear all different kind of sounds and noises from outside, but, really, if you are just looking for a place to spend a night, it is fine. Booking tip: I went on the hotel's website to better understand the room types, and saw a "register as a vip guest" tab, promising better rates, etc, so, I registered. I got an email confirmaton immediately, but nothing else, really. So I thought, oh well, I'll just book tomorrow at whatever regular rates there are on the website. At that time, I was looking at $99 for the double queen beds room ($89 for the room + $10 for an extra adult). That evening, however, I got a phone call from a sales person from the hotel asking if I still wanted to book - as a VIP guest now - so I did - at the rate of $59 total for the same room! Not too bad at all!! Last, I should mention the complimentary breakfast. Honestly, it's not too bad either. It is served in the smallest-ever "lobby", but its plentifulness will surprise you. There was hot (instant) and cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, muffins, oranges, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, and orange juice (maybe I'm forgetting something) that one can take without any limit. So, really, nothing fancy, but fills you up quite OK. And, if you are up at early (hotel breakfast starts at 7:30), like we were, at 4am, due to the time difference from Toronto.., there is Denny's just accross the street, with all their waffles/pancakes/eggs/etc, so you can grab something before. Check out time is 11am, which is very convenient for cruising people, as you just pack your bags and take the 5min stroll to the terminal (where boarding usually starts around that time, 11-11:30). There is Days Inn right next doors, and a much bigger Holiday Inn even closer to the port terminal (across the street from it, actually), but do you really need to pay an extra $100 to ride in their glass elevator?..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Stay”
Reviews.Author: kaushiksampath
Reviews.Content: Great Location close to many key areas accessible by trolley/bus and close to the harbor Friendly and helpful staff particularly the front-desk manager, John No bells and whistles but comfortable to stay Breakfast adequate but a separate dining area would be better

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and value!”
Reviews.Author: justmeclay
Reviews.Content: (we stayed from Thursday 10/7- Sunday 10/10/2010) I took my honey to San Diego for a surprise birthday getaway on a small budget. To be honest, when I booked this room I really was not expecting much due to the extremely “low” rates I received but much to my surprise the hotel was great! The staff was amazing, friendly and helpful. John was extremely nice; he printed travel maps with coupons to the museum’s we were headed to without me having to ask him. I had a million questions and he was more than happy to answer every one of them. Every morning that I went down for the “free” Continental Breakfast, John asks how our night and activities were going and he seemed really interested. He gave me suggestions on things to do and places to go. The room was small but cozy, neat, clean with a gorgeous view of the water. The location of the hotel was the best minus the trains which I didn’t mind or notice after awhile. The convenience and easy access to everything trumped the small amount of San Diego city outside noise. All of our activities were no more than 5-15 minutes away. We hit the museums located at Balboa Park. We went to Coronado Island, Downtown “Gas Lamp District”, Horn blower Curies and Belmont Park. Little Italy, which is less than a five-minute walk from the Hotel, was having their annual festival on Sunday and John let us leave our car parked in the lot for a couple of hours after we had checked out without a problem. I had a truly amazing time and stay in San Diego!!! We will book at the Marina Inn & Suites again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Amazing Sunset, Nice room!”
Reviews.Author: Summerseeker222
Reviews.Content: Our first night in San Diego we stayed at the Motel 6 down the street. On vacation, my husband and I save money on hotel, spend extra money on good food and good experiences. So, we went to Motel 6 figuring how bad could it be? Don't waste your money there!! We checked out early the next morning. Between the strip club across the street, the disgusting carpets, and rude front desk we decided to see what else we could find. So happy we found the Marina Inn and Suites! It was the first hotel we stopped at. The rate was only a few dollars more than the Motel 6 but had the same amenities like a continental breakfast (small but my husband was in heaven with the eggs), free (working!) wireless internet, and free parking. Their parking lot was small but it seems like a lot of hotels in the downtown area of San Diego charge $10 + per night for parking so it was appreciated. The room was nicer than I expected - looks like it had been recently renovated. Clean carpet, bathroom, sheets, etc. No sign of any insects. Rooms are on the small side! But that was not really a problem since the view we had made up for it. Try to request a room on the second floor... from our bed we could watch a beautiful sunset hitting the boats in the harbor and Coronado :) The front desk staff we talked to, Emily and John, were great. Sweet, full of suggestions, and funny too! Much better than the rude, uncaring treatment we received right down the street. Downside: No laundry on site. This is a noisy location! There are trains, planes, and automobiles at all times. Small parking lot - but they did provide a free alternative lot right down the street, so kudos for that. We will be making reservations here for our next trip to San Diego in January, and can't wait to be back in this beautiful, sunny city!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, ants, would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: HCasino
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the girl the checked us in acted like she was on drugs. She was really strange. Then when we walked into the room we noticed ants all over our bathroom and we had to shake out all of our towels. We stayed for 3 nights and on the third night when we drove back to the hotel after a long day, there was no free parking available. So, I went to the front desk to inform the girl and she said we could park down the block at their sister hotel. I told her I didn't feel comfortable with that because there were signs posted everywhere saying park at your own risk. If I parked my car down the street, I wouldn't be able to see it from my room. She wasn't helpful at all and again was acting very strange. I did not feel comfortable staying at this hotel and the staff wasn't helpful. I felt like a hassel than a guest there. Pros: New decor in room, pretty good location. Cons: Ants, crappy parking lot with limited spots, area of town was kind of shady, staff was very unhelpful and unfriendly. I wouldn't stay here again, ever!

Reviews.Title: “I was very satisfied with my stay at the Marina Inn&Suites”
Reviews.Author: henrystlaurent9
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Marina Inn&Suites of San Diego, CA. I had a beautiful view of the Marina especially for the price compared to other motels in the area. Also the room was very clean and I had a micro/frig, a large t.v., and a nice continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Capthook
Reviews.Content: As many have said, this is a small, older hotel, but maintained nicely. We were greeted by Andrew who was very friendly with a welcoming sense of humor. He was very good about answering our questions and making sure we got everything that we needed. We were given room 207 which was tucked in the back hallway on the second floor. I've had the "tucked away" room in other hotels and have found that they do not always represent what other rooms are like, they are more like an afterthought or an attempt to get one more unit out of a former storage room. This room was decidely better than that. Room 207 is a King bed, "smoking" room. I say "smoking" in parentheses, because it is actually labled as a non-smoking room and had no ashtrays when we checked in. When we questioned it, we were told that it really was a smoking room and we were given ashtrays. I've had that happen a lot at other hotels so I mention it as a caveat to travelers who insist on a completely non-smoking room. The room was smallish, but very clean and appointed with a sizeable TV, end tables and a table and two chairs. The view was of the wall of the property next door, but I think that was a benefit to reduce the noise of the nearby train tracks. We are not really all that sensitive to noise and found no problem with the train or airport noise. Parking is kind of limited so I wouldn't want to check in too late on a busy weekend. The hotel will suggest off-site parking, but I think it's safer to park at the hotel. The only thing that I questioned was a little note in the bathroom that advised guests to use the red washcloth to remove makeup "to avoid additional charges". Apparently they are concerned about stained white wash cloths. I've never seen anything like this in any hotel and thought it was kind of strange. I use white wash cloths at home and find that any detergent works well to remove makeup stains on towels. The motel also assesses a $50 security charge which they refund when you check out. Not sure what that's for - perhaps it has something to do with the notice in the room advising that customers will be charged for anything that turns up missing. The notice actually lists the prices for what they will charge. I initially thought that was a little odd and sort of unfriendly, but I guess it can be a major problem if you're running a little motel. No harm, no foul really. The location is really the best asset of this property. It's an easy walk to the restaurants and attractions of Little Italy and also the Trolley station. If you are staying over the weekend, do not miss the Saturday farmers market on Date Street in Littly Italy. Amazing! Overall, we had a very good stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, near downtown”
Reviews.Author: ournamehere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very basic, inexpensive hotel so I was not expecting a lot. It is a good place to stay if you need to crash for a few days without the frills. Pros: The bed was comfy and the pillows were fluffy, staff was very friendly and helpful, it was within walking distance to the train as well as other places (gaslamp, midway, conference center), room was clean, free wireless Cons: Breakfast was very basic (oatmeal, coffee, boxes of cereal, hardboiled eggs, juice/milk), it was near a busy and loud (during the day) intersection, it was close enough to the airport to hear the planes coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Lost reservation”
Reviews.Author: Marcuss35
Reviews.Content: On aug. 11 they lost our reservation and they send us on Vagabond inn on circle street at 300 ft. of the freeway 8 . in a room of the 80's dirty and noisy its a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ColinLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Came down with the wife for the last day of ComicCon. I found the people behind the desk very helpful. Especially John. I'd forgotten my ComicCon tickets so he suggested I email him the link so he could print them out for me. He was also very attentive and caught that one of the tickets I emailed him didn't have a barcode (which I needed), so I resent it to him and he printed it out again. The room was clean. And the location was great, being only a couple of minutes walk from the Harbor Front. This is essentially a small, two story motel, not a hotel, but it's a good one. It has your basic amenities, HBO, wi-fi, and a bare-bones continental breakfast - wrapped muffins, fruit, cereal and porridge, plus coffee and orange juice. The room was expensive, but it was ComicCon and every jacks up their prices for it. And it was actually the cheapest one I could find on Hotwire. So no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Great location, Continental breakfast, Adequate for Comic Con stay”
Reviews.Author: CW_from_CA
Reviews.Content: There is nothing under $200 available for the week of Comic Con (7/21-7/25) in San Diego, we were pleasantly surprise to find this hotel with a kids' suite (bunk beds in a separate room) under $200 per night. Having two queen beds and a separate bunk bed was great for our sleeping comfort! The hotel location was just right close to all the public transportation (trolley, Amtrak) and one block from the Comic Con bus route, which saves us rental car and parking money. You can hear the trains at times, especially when Amtrak honks its horn. However, we see it as a trade off of convenience and we would rather have the convenience. So overall, it was not a problem for us. I read the reviews by other customers beforehand and remembered John was mentioned as the most friendly staff member. Indeed, he was the one greeted us when we check-in and every morning. He made us feel right at home. The continental breakfast was sufficient for us to do a "brunch", there were muffins, coffee, OJ, milk, cereal etc., the best was the hard boiled egg. It was served at their very compacted lobby area, but everything was clean and well-presented. Probably the only thing I would comment is the newly painted kid's suite still has the paint smell, and it could become bothersome if you have the window closed. If you do not open all windows (3) in the room, sometimes the ventillation gets bad. This is not a Marriott or Hilton (can't even get in this week, or at $400 a night), however, very much a true-to-value stay for our travel. Will recommend for stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Prices, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: martinez80
Reviews.Content: This motel is located minutes from downtown and the gaslamp quarter, and seconds from little italy. The rates were reasonable, and the rooms were clean, but it was the service that stood out for us. Emily at the front desk was very helpful in recommending a place for us to dine that evening, and my husband and I ended up having a lovely and romantic first night in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: darshanjp9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to San diego this past weekend and we stayed at the Marina Inn and Suites. My wife is very particular about where she stays but she loved this place. The hotel was great, offered many amenities, close to the airport, and the rates were reasonable in comparison to other hotels in the nearby area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: brad_j_w
Reviews.Content: Great little inn, walking distance to the waterfront, downtown etc. Friendly staff (Manager John and the housekeepers). Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Turtles004
Reviews.Content: First we cancelled a reservation from (Harborview Inn & Suites) that was horrible so we left before we even got in and unknown if we will be getting our money back from that one at this time. We were very glad that we did not let the first place ruin our vacation. We drove around and found this hotel and were welcomed by "John" he was very friendly and helpful. The location was in a busy area but convenient. Right by the Harbor and Ferry as well as the ship Museum that we all enjoyed. This was also close to a variety of Restraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the best experience ever and most professional staff”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler360
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the marina inn and suites on business and wow what a great experience it was. I was in town on business for the human resources convention. The convenience and location of the property to the convention center was great. I have been in many many hotels and want to commend John the manager he was absolutely fantastic from the moment of my check in to my check out. When I arrived the office was full of people and the phone was ringing repeatedly and it never stressed him or at least he didn't show it. He was able to handle it smoothly and professionally with no problems I was very impressed. I could see him running a 5 star hotel. He is a major asset to that company. If I was to own a company I definitely would build it around him knowing how successful he would make my company. Now on to the hotel itself convenience to the convention center with in 1 mile, Airport with in 1 mile, Little Italy, Old town, Sea port Village, Beautiful harbor drive, there is a lot more to the area than just the zoo and sea world. The beautiful view of the harbor with the palm trees and sunset was worth every penny. The short distance to balboa park. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient located hotel and will definitely return with my family to stay there again. Thank you marina inn for the awesome service and a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal...and professionalism, too!!”
Reviews.Author: Contentedvisitors
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Fiesta Metric Bike Ride and made reservations back in April. Having never stayed there, and only having the information provided on Expedia, we made an excellent choice. At check-in there was a problem with the room, because we (thought) that we had requested a downstairs room, but there was no record. John, the manager, tried everything to accomodate us; the room on the first floor was the same as on the 2nd floor, except with a refrigerator, so we decided to keep the upstairs room originally assigned to us. (We had to carry our bikes upstairs--our fault). The bed and pillows were most comfortable--and from a woman's point of view, I loved the mint green sheets! The room was small but that was not a deterent. Cleanliness was obviously high on their priority. Everything was immaculate, from the room, bathroom to the parking lot. It would be great IF they put refrigerators in all the rooms. On the down-side: 1)the location of the bathroom door to the toilet was an issue 2) the shower head was way too low down...I'm 5'6" and had to shrink down to get my hair wet, 3) the room is not equipped with sufficient electrical outlets4) the Disabled parking slot is not readily accessible 5) the landscaping blocks the southern staircase to the rooms with southern exposure. All that being said, we have to commend John, the Manager, for his professionalism and astute awareness as to what was appropriate. There was a terrible automobile accident at the intersection of Grape and Ash..right in front of the hotel, on Saturday afternoon; John intuitively knew what to do. He called 911 and offered traffic cones to the police first on the scene. We were quite impressed. We will definitely stay there again, if John is still there. He really makes the place! :)

Reviews.Title: “Heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TonyTimesTorC
Reviews.Content: This Marina Inn & Suites on the southeast corner of the Pacific Highway and Grape Street in San Diego immediately stood out in an Ortibz listing. I was sold on location, pricing (two nights, two adults about $175) and the online photo of the motel property. On arrival, my reasonable expectations for a quality stay were surpassed from the first minute of our early arrival. The executive housekeeper and sometime front desk manager, Nisha, told us early check-in was not a problem but that it would take housekeeping a half-hour to get our room ready. In the meantime, she directed us toward Harbor Drive and pier. This is truly the heart of San Diego (for us anyway). Our “quick” stroll ended up with our visiting the USS Midway Museum (the flight deck is impressive but it’s the stroll through the tight, winding ship’s quarters where you get a fascinating glimpse into the life of a naval aviator) and enjoying a first rate seafood/Italian lunch at Anthony’s Fish Grotto (excellent service too). When we returned to the Marina Inn & Suites for our official check-in a couple hours later, Nisha upon inquiry added to our accommodations with a two-bed, smoking room at no extra charge. Our stay was on a presumably slower Monday and Tuesday, but you get the sense this motel staff treats its guests to first-class service every day of the week. Wi-fi, excellent air conditioning, cable TV, coffeemaker, bottled water and disposable cups are among the top amenities, not to mention granite countertops and elegant furnishings. No fridge or microwave in our unit, but we had a cooler on hand, and forget the microwave when Little Italy is just a couple of streets east of the motel. Five-star (on a scale of 1 to 5) motel all the way, but just for fun I’m awarding Sleep Quality only four stars, and not because the beds aren’t extremely comfortable, but because our Room 206 looks out toward the corner of Pacific and Grape, and I’m sitting in the middle of the L-shaped building and staring out toward a lovely overcast/foggy cityscape with palm trees, moderately heavy traffic, streetlights, a Mobil gas station (convenient), an architectural curiosity behind that, and in the intermediate distance tree-lined residential hills and descending from the right of my window view and descending westward and to my left, commercial jetliners touching down at San Diego National Airport a mile or so away looking to the northwest. We highly recommend the Marina Inn & Suites and look forward to visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “best location and room for the money I paid”
Reviews.Author: 1-sajjad
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for some days and then had to go to LA for a few days. I returned straight to Marina Inn when I came back to San Diego till my flight back home. Sea Port village, Little Italy, and Harbour Drive with cruise terminal are in 5 minutes of pleasant walk. Train terminal is also at 3 minute walk. You are staying right in the fun area. Airport just 5 minute taxi ride, worth of less than 15 dollars. Check map. Ample free parking too.

Reviews.Title: “In all of it, a heart still beats.”
Reviews.Author: Surf64
Reviews.Content: Every year to escape the dreariness of the mid-west I go to San Diego. (I also lived there years ago) Two days by train can be fun but it can leave you tired. Me, who never makes reservations-dumb, though I can always count on Marina Inn. Last year during the Comic Con when all others were booked they still managed ge to put me up for the entire week and I didn't have change rooms either. This year I went, again no Reso's--dumb me, but Nisha took excellent care of me, I got a room for the entire stay. My room was cleaned every day, I showered each day and always had a fresh supply of linen. The bed was never musty always clean. There was always someone in the office. One night I went to us the Soda machine, wanted Ice Tea but was dispensed Orange Fanta instead--not happy--however the young man at the desk there had ice tea and swapped it out, now that might sound trifle but but he he took care of my issue and did it it without any problem--Isn't that really what service is all about? I could have been told "Sorry" but he made the effort to rectify the needs of this cranky old customer. Now sleeping with the Pacific Highway, Amtrak, BNSF freight, and a plethora of planes may not induce silent sleep, but the attention and service that I recieve more than makes up for that and ANY Hotel or Motel along there is subjected to the same but its the service I recieve that will bring me back to them time and again. Nisha is very professional and courteous and will work with me in planning my stays. Also if you shower long like I do their water is ALWAYS hot and lasting!!! Pricing is great and I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Spacious Rooms, Good for Exporing San Diego,Excellent Value,”
Reviews.Author: Rio020
Reviews.Content: We only had time to spend one night here, but found the room very clean, also had a fridge and lovely view of ocean, good choice of food for breakfast. Within walking distance of Tram station for Gaslamp Area,Seaport Village, Convention Centre etc: San Diego Zoo, 05 minutes by car. John on reception was friendly and knowledgeable of area, supplying maps if required, nothing too much trouble. Hope to go back next year and would definatley, stay here again. Marion UK

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown-marina area hotel for the money, includes bay views!”
Reviews.Author: tjburke85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Pacific right across the street from the harbor. It boasts beautiful sunrise bay views each morning. Included is wireless internet, continental breakfast, and refridge/microwave in some rooms. A full breakfast and a pool is at a sister hotel a blocks walk away (Pacific Inn, much more $$$, why pay? Stay at Marina Inn, Walk a block and get these amenities). The rooms must have been recently renovated with granite counter tops on the furniture and bathrooms, and are kept nice and clean. Whats best for this hotel is the value! Call the manager John for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy, it vibrates”
Reviews.Author: SusieWicker
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is perched at the intersection of 2 major thoroughfares, there is a railroad track at the back, and it is a short distance from the international airport. It is so noisy, day and night, that the poor little motel just vibrates. We booked thru Hotwire and could not get our money back, so we paid more to stay at their other motel down the street which was acceptable. If you are indifferent to the noise, the motel has a good central location, good cleanliness, good service, and is inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: musicsandiego
Reviews.Content: I own a concert venue in San Diego and we use the Marina Inn and Suites for our guests who are primarily musicians and their associates. This is a very picky group of people and the Marina Inn has far exceeded our expectations. Our customers are always happy and this is the most important thing to our business. Thanks Marina

Reviews.Title: “Small, noisy and not near anything”
Reviews.Author: payingitforward1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we needed the space it provided. The main problem was the noise. We could hear the trains all night long. The motel also faces a major highway and it is loud. Breakfast was skipable. 10-15 mins drive from attractions. Parking is limited and tight.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoLoving
Reviews.Content: I was on a lengthy search for a hotel nearby the beach, Sea World, downtown and the zoo until I came across Marina Inn at Grape St. and Pacific Coast Highway. It took me 10 minutes to decide after getting my quote. Once I mentioned AAA, I got a huge savings! When I got to the hotel, my room was ready to go with a pleasant view of the harbor. Once I began driving around, I realized how close I was to everything! Zoo was right up the road, litterally. Downtown was about 5 minutes, Sea World was no more than 10 minutes away! Vicky P takes her job very seriously to work the best deals and ensures the trip runs smoothly! I couldn't ask for a better hotel, hence why I'm returning with my fiance this coming May.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service....”
Reviews.Author: Michael_la_9
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego in the past month for a trip to visit a friend and I chose to stay at the maina inn and suites for 2 days. I should say that the place is really well maintained and the staff is very friendly and helpful. My flight reached at 10 in the morning and Dhiman who was at the front desk was kind enough to give me an early check in. And if that wasn’t enough he also let me have the continental breakfast they serve every morning. I was really impressed by the customer service he provided. The room was in great condition as well. They had a fridge and a microwave in there as well. Marina Inn is located in a very convenient location. Little Italy is close by, there’s a 7-11 right next door, a rite aid and several restaurants as well. The Gaslamp district is just a 5 min drive. Overall I had a great experience and hope this review helps tourists looking for great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellet experience.”
Reviews.Author: monte_magoo
Reviews.Content: I was kind of skeptical at first staying at Marina Inns and Suites due to the factor of never staying at any of their locations. My wife and I were coming down to San Diego, California, for both business and leisure and decided to taked advantage of a special advertized price on Orbitz.com. At first we only booked the hotel room for one night just in case our experience was not up to par or what we expected. But after my experience with check in with Dhiman and the way that our room was presented, I immediately booked an additional two nights at the Marina Inns and Suites due to the overall experience that I received. The Marina Inn and Suites definately raises the bar and steps it up a notch. With lots of competition in the area, Marina Inns and Suites definately holds a bar even though it's a fairly small hotel, it still gives you the experience of a major corporate chain. I feel that on a scale between 1 to 5 stars this should be a 4.5 star hotel. I hate to give it 4.5 and not 5, but the only issue that we seem to have and it's not a big issue is there's no restaurant or lounge on cite -- but there is plenty in the surrounding area. But once again for the size of the hotel, it's definately the best for your dollar. As long as there are people like Dhiman, your hotel experience will only be pleasant. Just to remind you again, to experience Dhiman along with the other staff for their excellence in service you have to travel to Marina Inns and Suites -- you have to travel to San Diego. I hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: neanderthal_online
Reviews.Content: It is the 4th time that I stay in the hotel, it is well located close to downtown within walking distance of the little italy trolley station close to the harbour for an evening stroll. The staff is friendly and helpful, my best experience with them was dec 2008 when we were delayed on the road for 3 days due to snow, coming from northern canada, I phoned them and delayed our arrival 3 times, they kept it for us even after so many rescheduling and kept the promised rate. Whatelse could prove to be a good place. The rate for a city like San diego are good.

Reviews.Title: “Uninformed”
Reviews.Author: quenUSA
Reviews.Content: During check in we were not informed that the suite had bunked beds or that there would be a fee for water and a safe, which was charged to my credit card. The following morning while getting ready the power went off on our suite not the building. We try to changed to a couple of rooms instead but the prices were high making it almost to 300.00 for a two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: raywan
Reviews.Content: There are both plus and minuses to staying at the Marina Inn. First, the pluses: -GREAT location. It's right off Pacific Highway, next to the waterfront. It's close to great Italian restaurants off India St., and very close to destinations such as the Zoo, Sea World, USS Midway, and Old town. -Tidy rooms. While it was not absolutely spotless, it was overall pretty clean and the furnishings were fine. -Excellent Rates. For under $70, we got a room that could sleep four people. You can't beat that. Now for the minuses.... -While it's close to major attractions, it's also off a busy road and the train tracks, so sometimes the noise at night can be a bother, especially if you are a light sleeper. -The rooms tend to have this weird chemically smell- not sure if it's the air freshener or what, but it was a bit off-putting when you first walk in. -The attendant at the front desk was a bit absent minded. While he was nice and tried to be helpful, he sent us to a sister hotel down the block to pick up discount tickets to local attractions, but it turned out they actually did not have any available. It wasn't a huge deal since it was just down the block, but he did mistakenly assure us it would be there, and this actually happened TWICE. OVERALL, it was fine for the price, but there are a few things they can work on to make it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right by the water!”
Reviews.Author: kyden
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights - one was on a weeknight and the other on a weekend. The best 2 things about this hotel were it's close location to the Marina/Cruise Ship Terminal and the service. The rest was kind of...average. Since the hotel was close to the water it also was close to the airport. You could hear airplane noise all day and night, but I got used to it pretty fast. You could also hear the trolley/Amtrak when it went by from time to time. The hotel itself was fairly clean, but the bed was average and the bathroom was the same size as the bedroom. Not necessary I think - although it would be excellent for wheelchair accessible guests - as it was a room on the ground floor and had a good set up. The service at the front desk was excellent - always friendly and helpful. Make sure to check your rates though - on my weekend night I was charged a higher rate and then the next weekend night I wanted to see if I could get cheaper so I went down the street to the Pacific Inn - they told me they could not give me a good rate, but they could give me a good rate back at the Marina Inn. It wasn't exactly what I was wanting to hear because I had just been charged $20+ more at the hotel the night before. I guess it pays to bargain - because these hotels seem to reduce rates if you mention something.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yorkie1209
Reviews.Content: so i checked online and the price said 80, i gave them a call to confirm and the indian man said 89 and i told him online said 80 so he said "ok u come over now, i give u discount". so me and my boyfriend drove over there and the price went up to 109, he said "because u dont give me credit card number i dont hold room for u, now price is 109" we walked out and soon enough he chased after us and said "ok i give u for 85". so we decided to stay and regretted it as soon as we entered the room. they had roaches running down the bathroom curtains, the bed sheets had burnt holes thru them, the towels looked dirty, the bathroom super small. shower filled with pee stains and tiles coming out, and noise throughout the whole night cuz of the train and traffic. absolutely the worst place ever !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Marina was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mayweun
Reviews.Content: We were able to book last minute reservations because of a totally unacceptable reservation at a different motel. The desk staff was lovely and so very nice to us. The rooms were clean, freshly painted, and had plenty of towels. There were too few parking places which was a problem for us. We would have liked to have a pool on site but the Pacifica pool worked in a pinch. The breakfast was very skimpy not what I consider a continental breakfast.. We also had power outages in the morning while we tried to get ready. Just not enough power to go around. I'd go back but I wouldn't take all the grandkids and their parents with us.

Reviews.Title: “I love SD”
Reviews.Author: stevemarin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were pretty small if you plan to be inside for a long period of time. It's perfect for crashing after drinking all day at the beach and then crashing back again after a long night partying in dowtown. It's close to everything! Perfect for JUST crashing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a bit noisy, but manageable”
Reviews.Author: erebus_111
Reviews.Content: The rate I paid was much lower than listed on this site, for some reason. I paid less than $80. I was pleasantly surprised at the Marina Inn based on some of the reviews here. The rooms were clean and well-lit, lots of sun, overall a positive feeling when I first got there. The room, while small, was adequate and very workable. Lots of good television stations and the shower and hot water situation was great. (The bathroom in my room was huge! Very nice.) However, it is a noisy location. I was concerned about the airport noise, but that wasn't a problem. The hotel is near the landing path, so the throttles are low and not noisy. The noise problem was with the traffic on Pacific Highway and adjacent streets. The train tracks are also right behind the properyt, but they didn't seem to run the noisy trains after about 10:00 p.m. I brought ear plugs, and those, with the room fan on high, drowned out the noise so that I got a good night's sleep. No complaints about that, but beware! The other thing to note is that they 'nickel and dime' you to death. Don't use the phone (all calls are charged, even credit card calls and 1-800 calls). Make sure you don't drink the bottled water, it's like $2.50 a bottle. Don't use the safe in the room, there is a charge for that!!! Luckily, there is no charge for watching TV or using the shower. I did have a problem with the TV remote, but since I know how to re-program universal remotes, I was able to reset mine. I would definitely stay again, it's right near the bus line and the trolley system (since I didn't have a car). Lots within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but basic”
Reviews.Author: resumeready
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the ESRI conference. Room was clean and comfortable. Although they put me in a room right next to the highway, the traffic noise was tolerable. TV was old and the screen was scratched, but I didn't really use it that much. Tram stop was not too far. No complaints, but this is not more than a basic "place to sleep" motel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MongoRa
Reviews.Content: We were in town for ComiCon. Given that the Marina Inn had a 1&1/2 star rating my expectations were low. But the rate was good for a busy convention week. At first glance one can easily see the building as a once seedy highway motel. But now the exterior is clean and bright. I was surprised to see the rooms looked newly decorated and attractive. The bathroom counter in our room was or looked very much like dark granite. Paint looked new as well. Only the shower needed to be updated but functioned well. Upgrades seem ongoing as exterior stucco and paint were being worked on. A simple continental breakfast was served in the office. The inn is located a block from the water so there was always a sea breeze. I don't think there are any beaches near by. The trolly ( which was a joy to use ) is a block away. Within walking distance are ship museums where you can tour old sailing ships or the aircraft carrier USS Midway. At least a half dozen eating options are within a block or two; Everything from fast food to steak. The area is called 'Little Italy'. Plus, the trolly will take you to the 'Gaslamp Quarter' which has too many eateries to list, as well as movie theaters. Overall all, I was very pleased. The Marina Inn & suites makes a fine base from which to explore downtown San Diego. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Marina Inn & Suites Rules!”
Reviews.Author: spanky80
Reviews.Content: I had an Excellent experience staying at the Marina Inn & Suites in San Diego. The Office staff was extremely helpful,and the room was clean , fairly new, and cleaned very well every day. The motel was so convienent to so many attractions and I am looking forward to returning next summer for another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good & economic hotel”
Reviews.Author: puce3
Reviews.Content: Good stay for the price! Great deal for students or people who don't have a lot of money to spend on the hotel. Our room was clean (and with refrigerator) and the staff was friendly. The location (Little Italy quarter) was very good for a lot of attractions (Gaslamp and Little Italy quarters, Seaport Village, ocean) and with easy access in public transport for the Zoo, Balboa Park and museums, La Jolla quarter, Coronado Island, etc. The only bothering thing reported in many reviews was the sound of the train passing near the hotel in evening, but it wasn't that bad because it did not bother us while sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away At All Cost”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine048
Reviews.Content: On 10/22/07 we reserved a room via hotel.com at the Marina Inn, Pacific Hwy, San Diego, CA. when we were evacuated during the San Diego fires. That motel has the same owner, Vicky Patel, who owns the Vagabond Inn at Hotel Circle S, Mission Valley, San Diego, CA. This complaint involves both motels (See Vagabond Inn Mission Valley San Diego listing). On 10/22/07 Ms. Patel charged $159 a night for the Marina Inn even though the rack rate was $94.95 for these dates for a king bed and the internet rate, $64.95. The Motel is within 50 feet of a railroad crossing on a hilly main intersection within the flight path of the airport. Horns, train whistles, engines reving up the hill and airplanes landing weren't even the worst of it. The toilet was stopped up with feces. Maintenance came three times to no avail. The lights did not work. We moved to another room and unpacked but found water damage under a major part of the carpet. Vicky Patel told us that she would let us move to the Vagabond Inn, Mission Valley for the same price. Upon entering we were told the rack rate was $129 a night & with an AAA discount it would be $99. The internet displayed the AAA rate as $80.10. But Ms. Patel insisted that for us it would be $159 a night. I informed her that gouging is illegal (penal code 396(d)) & that I am an AAA member. She agreed to $99. We checked out of the Vagabond Inn on 10/25 @ 10 am. The Motel refused to give us a bill saying it can only be gotten from the Marina Inn. We went back to the Marina Inn. They also refused to give us bill. Hotel.com said they cannot help. AAA can't help since it was booked @ hotel.com. We stayed one night at the Marina Inn and 2 nights at the Vagabond Inn yet according to my credit card company we were overcharged and pre-charged $725. We are contesting. Stay away from anything that is owned by Vicky Patel. The BBB shows a poor record for both places.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Great!”
Reviews.Author: greg3072
Reviews.Content: Coming to San Diego for the first time, our stay at the Marina Inn was as pleasurable as the first night at the Holiday Inn Express, but only less expensive and a better view.
