If you are like me I enjoy the simple things in life, and the Marina Inn was very simple and cozy. The best part was the cool ocean breeze that came in the windows early in the morning, and the very accomodating staff. Monish is the Assistant Manger and was extremely welcoming and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for any first time out of town visiters looking to save money on hotels and spend it elsewhere....you'll defintely get more that what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “great people and value, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: tamaleman
Reviews.Content: Needing a place to stay the night before our 10 day cruise, at first I thought my wife made a mistake booking us in this hotel...as we approached, I saw it is located on a busy corner, two blocks from the freeway, one block from the train tracks, across the street from a gas station...., in other words, lots of noise.... But when we checked in, the staff was very helpful, placed us in the quietest room, which provided us with basic accomodations, which were fine, and we could walk three blocks to the cruise terminal to catch our ship. Best of all, they gave us a room rate that included parking for the 10 days we would be cruising. When we checked other hotels and the cost of public parking for the 10 day cruise, we figured we saved about $75. It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better to spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Travuler
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. The noise of the planes, trains, traffic, etc did not bother me, as I have stayed at other motels in this location before and was aware of that. The problems: at first they couldn't find the reservation. Then they tell you you can come at noon, then when you do, it's a huge deal because the room isn't ready and I shouldn' have come until 2pm. Then the safe they automatically charge you for was already locked, so the clerk gave me the "master" code (that made me want to leave things in there!!). Staff`are not friendly or helpful. Every day something was wrong - not enough towels, no facecloths, forgetting a pillowcase etc. no cups. There are no "do not disturb" signs, so the maid is banging on the door every 10 minutes in the morning - I'nm not sure what the rush was as not one day I was there did she get it right - don't expect to ever sleep late here! There were also numerous bugs in the room. Towels were full of holes. No bath-tub - only shower. No fridge, no coffee, etc. This place is not the cheapest motel around, but it should be. Next time I go low-budget, I would stay somewhere else, You can get a lot more services for the same price in other motels.

Reviews.Title: “Plastic covered mattresses!”
Reviews.Author: scadadle15
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel, we were too early to check in but there was a nice man behind the front desk that told us we could leave the car there and come back later to check in. When we came back, the nice man was gone and in his place was a very rude guy who acted like we were disturbing him from NOT doing his job. I had made the reservation 3 months prior to the trip and he seemed to have trouble finding the reservation but I handed him the receipt from hotels.com and he soon found it. He gave us the keys and barely said a word to us. I noticed a 8.5 x 11 sheet of paper taped near the front desk that had a bulleted list of rules and things about the hotel. One of the items on the list was that the two water bottles placed in the room are to be returned to the front desk upon check out or a 2.50 charge will be added to the bill. I couldn't believe that. We would never had known about this shady charge had I not been waiting for him to do his job and find my reservation and started reading the small writing on the list. I never got a reciept from him or anything indicating what I paid.. but since I paid on hotels.com when I made the reservation, I am hoping thats all I'll be charged for. The room was ok.. clean enough I guess but the mattresses were covered with plastic!!!! They crinkled horribly whenever you moved in the bed. They gave us two aweful stained towels for 4 people and were rude when we asked for more. The traffic, planes and railroad were really loud. The best part was when I plugged in my hair dryer in the room (not the bathroom), I was electrocuted!!! It was slightly stronger than an electric fence and left my hand numb for a while. Scary! The continental breakfast was some nasty raisin bread and coffee water. The guy behind the desk was so rude when we checked out. I didn't even mention the plastic beds or the electrocution. I just wanted out. We asked to purchase the discounted zoo tickets that they had advertised and he acted like we asked him for $100. He said we had to pay in cash only and he complained when he had to give us change. Rude, loud, dirty and dangerous!!!! oh.. and plastic friggin beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “very terrible”
Reviews.Author: paulyangtw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right by the rail raod (I can see the track thru my bath room window), and by the pacific hiway. I can hear trians horning around 1200AM (last train), and around 5 to 6 am(first tain) in the morning. also the Trucks and cars passing by. I can hardly sleep during my 3 nite stay. The parking space is not enough for all hotel guests. I was forced to park on the street one night when i retrun the hotel late. When i asked the front desk to return my parking fees upon check out (I was planning to park my car there for two days and fly to another city), the hotel staff claimed that she did not charge me any parking although she was supposed to do so (by yelling at me). I asked the staff to print me the detailed receipts and I pointed out there is a 30 dollar something Misc charges with a foot note saying PARKING, the staff even tried to fool me by saying it is the TAX (hey, I am foreign but not stupid). I was forced to act very rudely to get money back. This is the worst hotel that i have ever stayed. I seriously sugget that one should stay somewhere else if you are considering this place.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: Seyo
Reviews.Content: The Inn is located close to the airport, practically attached to railroad tracks, and next to a busy intersection. During our stay, we were entertained by loud planes late into the night, and very early in the morning. Trains passed by all night, reminiscent of the “Blues Brothers.” The car traffic from the airport noise was just as bad. This place is old, a relic from the "Spanish Inquisition." Our room was small and crammed. The children had to squeeze between walls and furniture to get around. The rooms are unkept. Our shower and bathroom door didn’t shut completely. Also, we could hear the other room’s showers when they were being used. When this much water was being used, it sounded like heavy construction equipment…very loud!! The A.C. made a lot of noise, but only provided cool air if you pressed your face up to the grill. They have placed a tiny safe into each room to which there is an additional $2.50 charge added on your bill, whether you use it or not. They claim it is a “valuable service” for you, but anyone could just walk out with this shoe box. They also charge you ahead of time $2.50 for two bottles of water that you are “going to drink,” although we didn’t even have bottles in our room. There is free parking, if you can find one. There are only 17 tiny parking spaces for 29 rooms. One guest told me he had to walk nearly a mile from the motel to find parking. You would be crammed in with an ultra compact car the way they have the spaces marked. This fine establishment also offers a continental breakfast. A hazy glass jug of O.J., and some slabs of Wal-Mart bread still in their plastic container. The Spartans ate better!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here for heaven's sake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't come here for the following reasons 1. The carpet is so filthy. I think it's never been vacuumed for a long time. 2. We caught 2 bedbugs 3. Some of the people in the area are suspicious looking. (maybe drug dealers, etc). One person checked-in for 1 week and said he's a constant occupant. 4. Restroom is dirty and have no exhaust fan. 5. The windows are not secured. anybody can just slide it and you'll get raped. I will never ever check in that motel again and I hope other people will be warned by my post about this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that with in two minutes of walking into the room which was badly in need of repair and a good cleaing I walked right back out! I requested a refund and was denied and decided I would rather loose the $70 then to chance getting scabies from this place...so I left without a refund and went a stones throw away to the ComfortInn and paied only $8 more and was given a beautiful room that was clean and in good repair! Travlers beware! Stay away from this place at all costs is is not worth the money you save!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: This is a budget Motor hotel. We took advantage of their stay and cruise package. We drove in from Phx, spent the night, walked to our cruise and left the car for the week. Came back a week later, picked up the car and left. No problems and excellent price. We did find it odd that they do these fly, cruise, and park packages, because they have very few parking spaces. In fact, they don't guarantee that guests will be able to park on premises. If your on a budget or just need a place to easily reach the airport or cruise ship pier, this place will meet those needs.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Content: I waited about a month before a large convention before booking a room and this establishment was the only one near downtown with rooms available. That should have been a warning sign…. I hate to admit it but I agreed to $219 a night for this place; When I arrived the manager tells me that they have no reservation for me. I present my e-mail confirmation, he looks in the computer and tells me that I cancelled this reservation two weeks ago I was in shock, I never cancelled this and I knew that there were literally no other rooms in town due to this convention. But wouldn’t you know it, the manager informs me that he does have a room for me but the price is now $250 per night due to some nonsense explanation, half of which I think was in Hindu, about web agency rates and cancellation fees. What could I do? I was totally taken advantage of. Here I was 2,000 miles from home in a town with no other hotel rooms. I agree to the charge and got to my room. When I first walked in I wondered how that something like a modern chain hotel like Westin and this place can both be called the same thing. I think the fair market value of this room is about $29 a night. In fact I think I may have seen this same room on an episode of Cops. The place reeked of mildew. The carpet was disgusting, turning your socks black. The phone didn’t work. The furniture was chipped and stained. An electrical outlet was missing its outlet and cover and had taped wiring exposed. The curtains had cigarette burns and were very stained…how do stains get on curtains? I did have one lucky turn in that my room had two beds, that way I could replace the top sheet with the brown streak, grey stain and cigarette burns from one bed for the one from the other bed which just had cigarette burn holes. The beds themselves were rock hard and the pillowcases had the same problem as the sheets. The bathroom was quite bad; the whole thing was done in painted over mildew. Even the tile in the unlighted, scary shower stall was painted over and peeling off. The drain in the shower was just a hole, no drain cover. All the while, a six lane road with a never ending parade of vehicles is roaring by while the airport is literally a mile away and there is both a Amtrack line and a Trolley line running 100 yards behind the “hotel”. The place was rumbling most of the time. Thankfully the rail lines seemed to not run between midnight and 7:00 am. I felt totally taken advantage of staying at this place. The management was impossible to communicate with and I could do nothing about it; I tried so hard to find another place during my four days here but the only thing I could find was 30 miles away in Carlsbad, CA. If you can tolerate dishonesty, filth, and noisy transportation going by all the time this place is for you; otherwise avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Rough but Fair”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nobody is perfect, and when you are booking a $100 per night hotel in San Diego you get what you pay for. The service isn't sterling, but it's not outwardly rude either. The Keepers are simply functional in their job duties so if you keep your expectations level you won't be dissapointed. The room was probably a bit below average. I'd measure it at about 10X15 and was very average in it's appointments. The bed was large and fairly comfortable, there was no microwave or coffee maker, but they did give me an iron and board for my entire 5 day stay. Basically the room was cramped but not uncomfortable. The location has it's ups and downs as well. Planes land less than a mile away and the train runs about 100 yards in the other direction. Pacific Blvd is never quiet and the neighborhood isn't upscale. That said - I never felt as though my sleep was interrupted or that I was in a particularly seedy part of town. The bottom line here is that if you book this place you have no business expecting top tier appointments and service. It's a $100 motel in San Diego. I enjoyed my stay knowing that the extra C-note per night was spent on enjoying my time in one of America's best cities.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude on the phone and they hung up on me when I called to confirm my reservation (they reserved the wrong room type). In person, the staff was very unfriendly and cold. The room was badly in need of repairs. The smoke detector cover was missing and there was no battery attached. The list goes on. The only reason I stayed here was that the San Diego Marathon was going on and so there were no hotels available for 20 miles. In hindsight, I should have stayed 20 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Illegal charges!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on Jan. 15, 2005 to stay one night on Jan. 27. The website quoted one price, the hotel called me back and wanted to charge me an extra $10 for the same room. I received a confirmation e-mail for Jan. 27 for what the website quoted as the price. I cancelled the reservation on Jan. 18. I looked at my credit card bill and noticed a charge to the Marina Inn & Suites on Feb. 28, 2005. I called and spoke to the owners and they insisted that I had a reservation on Feb. 27! I had no proof of this reservation, and they will not help me out! I'm cancelling my credit card. This establishment is very untrustworthy and practices very shady business deals.

Reviews.Title: “And you call this a hotel???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a visitor from Europe I've never seen a dump like this before. Outsmoked rooms, forgotten underware of the last run away guest in the closet, and a rude, cheating porter who rips you off your money ($145 a night) people beware, there are better and cheaper places to stay in SD. If you are suicidal this is the place to be, Noisy from the front by heavy trucks and from the back by amtrack (blow the whistle boy). Tear this place down please (I moved over to the Bristol hotel after the second night -- it was 3 stars better and cheaper)

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a mold-smelling bathroom (an attempted paint job to cover it up on the bathroom ceiling), a large rusty ring aroung the bathtub drain, dingy white towels, a bathroom door that has to be slammed in order to close it, a desk chair that will fall apart when sat in, claims to have free phone calls which was advertised on their website, however, I was charged $0.50 per call, then this is it. I would NEVER recommend this establishment to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week, good service and good location at a great price. Some noice from trains and street traffic. Close to marina, downtown, busses and trains.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had to call and make reservations - woke up person that answered the phone at the front desk at 11pm! He would not take my reservation, told me to call back in the AM and hung up on me! When I called back - he did not answer the phone. Hello are we NOT operating a business or WHAT! I might also mention that I am a tour operator and would never ever suggest to my clients this piece of trash property. Steer clear of this extremely rude and unprofessional motel!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Marina Inn for 3 days. It is very unfriendly, they have one of the worst and very rude front desk.Don't trust thier web site the photographs are not the actual room photos.Plus: 1. LocationMinus: 1. Unfriendly and unprofessoinal customer service 2. No common microwave (Charge $10 per day, if you request one) 3. Worst breakfast 4. Limited parking space 5. Chlorine smell in the roomsThe other good options near by are, 1. Holiday Inn Express (Marina Bay) 2. Marriott - Residence Inn 3. Days Inn

HotelInfo.Name: Marina Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1943 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
